body_html:
Hi drpngx, thanks for your reply, I think I need to make my questions more clear.

About question 1, the yp1 and yp2 are not constant, but the output of a network(whose last layer is a linear layer), therefore yp1 and yp2 might be changing each time. When I tried to use them as indices, I got an error. I forgot to record it and I will see if I can reproduce it later.

For questions 2, suppose context_ids = tf.constant([[0, 10], [2, 12], [4, 14], [8, 18]])
I have yp1 and yp2 of shape (3, 2), e.g., [[0, 1], [1, 2], [0, 2]] and I expect to get result [[0], [12], [8, 18]] (it might be padded and be the input of next layer). Is it possible?

I look forward to eager mode.

Thanks!
body_text:
Hi drpngx, thanks for your reply, I think I need to make my questions more clear.
About question 1, the yp1 and yp2 are not constant, but the output of a network(whose last layer is a linear layer), therefore yp1 and yp2 might be changing each time. When I tried to use them as indices, I got an error. I forgot to record it and I will see if I can reproduce it later.
For questions 2, suppose context_ids = tf.constant([[0, 10], [2, 12], [4, 14], [8, 18]])
I have yp1 and yp2 of shape (3, 2), e.g., [[0, 1], [1, 2], [0, 2]] and I expect to get result [[0], [12], [8, 18]] (it might be padded and be the input of next layer). Is it possible?
I look forward to eager mode.
Thanks!
body:
Hi drpngx, thanks for your reply, I think I need to make my questions more clear.

About question 1, the yp1 and yp2 are not constant, but the output of a network(whose last layer is a linear layer), therefore yp1 and yp2 might be changing each time. When I tried to use them as indices, I got an error. I forgot to record it and I will see if I can reproduce it later.

For questions 2, suppose `context_ids = tf.constant([[0, 10], [2, 12], [4, 14], [8, 18]])`
I have yp1 and yp2 of shape (3, 2), e.g., `[[0, 1], [1, 2], [0, 2]]` and I expect to get result `[[0], [12], [8, 18]]` (it might be padded and be the input of next layer). Is it possible?

I look forward to eager mode.

Thanks!
